fine_dining.name: Kaskis
signature_dishes: Seasonal surprise menu focused on local ingredients
Creative use of Finnish produce (fish, game, vegetables)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate, cozy, rustic-chic; located in a cellar
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book *very* far in advance. Turku's first Michelin-starred restaurant. Highly sought after.
fine_dining.local_tips: Led by chef Erik Mansikka. Known for its relaxed atmosphere despite the high quality. Emphasis on pure flavors and seasonal ingredients.

fine_dining.name: Smör
signature_dishes: Emphasis on local fish and vegetables
Well-executed classic techniques with modern twists
fine_dining.atmosphere: Stylish, elegant cellar vaults by the Aura River
fine_dining.booking_tips: Offers both tasting menus and à la carte. Good option for a high-quality lunch.
fine_dining.local_tips: Considered one of Turku's top fine dining establishments for years. Great location by the river.

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Mami
fine_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, bustling, popular bistro feel; riverside location
fine_dining.booking_tips: Very popular, especially evenings and weekends. Book ahead.
fine_dining.local_tips: A reliable favorite among locals for quality food and a lively atmosphere. Good for both casual lunches and nicer dinners.

casual_dining.name: Kuori
casual_dining.booking_tips: Very popular vegetarian/vegan spot. Offers interesting flavors.
casual_dining.local_tips: Known for its flavorful and inventive plant-based dishes, appealing even to non-vegetarians.

casual_dining.name: Tintå
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively, popular riverside spot; large terrace in summer
casual_dining.booking_tips: Great location by the Aura River. Can be busy.
casual_dining.local_tips: A versatile spot good for pizza, drinks, or a more substantial meal. The terrace is prime seating in summer.

casual_dining.name: Roster Turku
casual_dining.atmosphere: Industrial chic, stylish, located in a former bank building
casual_dining.booking_tips: Part of the same group as Kaskis. Offers a more relaxed but still high-quality experience.
casual_dining.local_tips: Focuses on high-quality ingredients prepared simply, often over charcoal. Also has a popular bar area.

casual_dining.name: Sergio's
signature_dishes: Pasta dishes (e.g., Carbonara, Cacio e Pepe)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Authentic Italian trattoria feel, often busy and lively
casual_dining.booking_tips: Known for authentic Italian food, particularly pizza and pasta. Run by Italians.
casual_dining.local_tips: A go-to place for many locals seeking genuine Italian flavors in Turku.

casual_dining.name: Panini
casual_dining.atmosphere: Casual, bustling cafe; popular lunch spot
casual_dining.booking_tips: Very popular for lunch, can be crowded. Good for a quick, tasty, and affordable meal.
casual_dining.local_tips: A Turku institution for decades, known for its wide variety of delicious panini.

street_food.name: Traditional Grill Kiosks ('Grilli')
specialties: Local specialties like 'Aurajuusto burger' (blue cheese burger) might be found
street_food.location: Various locations, e.g., near the Market Square or bus station.
street_food.local_tips: A Finnish late-night staple. Look for popular spots like 'Mantun Grilli' near the Market Square for a classic experience.

street_food.name: Hesburger
specialties: Kerrosateria (Layer Meal - their Big Mac equivalent)
street_food.local_tips: The dominant Finnish burger chain, founded in Turku. Trying Hesburger is a local fast-food experience.

street_food.name: Kebab/Pizza Places
street_food.local_tips: Very common street food option in Turku, as in most Finnish cities. Quality varies.

coffee_shops.name: Frukt Coffee Roasters
must_try: Espresso drinks using their own roasts
coffee_shops.local_tips: Turku's leading specialty coffee roastery. Passionate staff and high-quality coffee.

coffee_shops.name: Café Art
must_try: Enjoying the view by the Aura River
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Artistic, relaxed, beautiful location in an old building
coffee_shops.local_tips: Located in a beautiful old riverside building (Läntinen Rantakatu 5). Features rotating art exhibitions. Great place to relax.

coffee_shops.name: Gaggui Kaffela
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Stylish, modern, popular for its cakes
coffee_shops.food_options: Focus on cakes, some savory options might be available
coffee_shops.local_tips: Famous in Turku for its beautiful and delicious cakes. Several locations.

coffee_shops.name: MBakery - Piece of Cake
coffee_shops.food_options: Wide range of baked goods, cakes, lunch
coffee_shops.local_tips: Run by Mikko Hietala, known for winning Finland's Best Bakery TV show. Located in Turku Market Hall.

bars.name: Uusi Apteekki
signature_drinks: Large selection of Finnish and Belgian beers
bars.atmosphere: Located in a former pharmacy ('apteekki'), quirky decor, traditional pub feel
bars.local_tips: A Turku institution. Famous for its vast beer selection and unique setting in an old pharmacy.

bars.name: The Old Bank ('Vanha Pankki')
signature_drinks: Good selection of beers on tap and bottled
bars.atmosphere: Grand setting in a former bank building, high ceilings, classic pub decor
bars.local_tips: Impressive interior makes it a popular spot. Good range of drinks.

bars.name: Cosmic Comic Cafe
signature_drinks: Good selection of rotating craft beers
bars.atmosphere: Relaxed, filled with comic book art and memorabilia; board games available
bars.local_tips: A casual and fun place, especially for comic fans or those looking for a relaxed beer.

bars.name: Walo Rooftop Bar
bars.atmosphere: Modern, stylish, panoramic views over Turku
bars.local_tips: Located on top of the Original Sokos Hotel Wiklund. Offers the best high-up views of the city center.

food_tours.name: Turku Food Tours (Self-Guided/Potential)
food_tours.focus: Local Delicacies, Market Hall, Riverside Eateries
highlights: Exploring Turku Market Hall (Kauppahalli) for local cheeses, fish, meats, pastries
Walking along the Aura River and stopping at cafes/restaurants like Tintå, Mami, Smör
Visiting Market Square (Kauppatori) for seasonal produce or snacks
Trying local specialties like 'Hesburger' or 'Aurajuusto' (blue cheese)
food_tours.booking_tips: Formal guided food tours might be less common than in Helsinki. Consider the 'Food Walk' card (check availability/current status) which sometimes allows tasting portions at participating restaurants. Otherwise, create your own tour focusing on the Market Hall and riverfront.

cooking_classes.name: Turku Cooking Classes (Limited Availability)
what_you_learn: Might include baking traditional Finnish bread or pastries
Seasonal cooking based on local ingredients
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Check adult education centers ('Työväenopisto' / 'Arbis') or look for specific workshops by local chefs/restaurants, although dedicated tourist-oriented cooking classes are less common than in Helsinki. Booking essential if found.

markets.name: Turku Market Hall (Turun Kauppahalli)
highlights: Excellent selection of meat, fish (especially from the archipelago), cheese, bread, pastries
Several cafes and lunch restaurants inside (e.g., MBakery, Herkkunuotta fish soup)
Local specialties like smoked fish and archipelago bread
markets.local_tips: A must-visit in Turku for food lovers. Great place for lunch or to buy high-quality local products. Less tourist-focused than Helsinki's Old Market Hall.

markets.name: Turku Market Square (Turun Kauppatori)
highlights: Seasonal produce: berries, vegetables, mushrooms, flowers
Food stalls (especially in summer) offering coffee, pastries, sometimes grilled sausages or other snacks
Center of city life, surrounded by shops
markets.hours: Mon-Sat year-round (mornings mainly), busiest during summer weekdays.
markets.local_tips: Best in summer for fresh Finnish produce like strawberries and new potatoes. Also hosts events and Christmas markets.

spring: Vappu treats (May 1st): Tippaleipä (funnel cake), Munkki (doughnuts), Sima (mead)
summer: New potatoes ('uudet perunat') from nearby regions (e.g., Naantali) with herring ('silli') or dill butter
Abundant fresh berries from Market Square: Strawberries ('mansikat'), Blueberries/Bilberries ('mustikat'), Raspberries ('vadelmat')
Crayfish parties ('rapujuhlat') - late summer (July/August), often available at restaurants
autumn: Wild mushrooms found in local markets
Game meats (check availability in Market Hall)
winter: Christmas Buffet ('Joulupöytä') offerings in restaurants: Christmas Ham ('Joulukinkku'), various Casseroles, Rosolli salad, Herring dishes
Blinis with roe, sour cream, and onion (restaurants often feature these Jan-Feb)
Runeberg Torte ('Runebergintorttu') - available in cafes Jan-Feb 5th
Shrove Tuesday buns ('Laskiaispulla') - cream/jam filled buns
